subject: Ethics
title: Moral Particularism
description: A short lesson to help you apply Moral Particularism.

hook.text: Honesty is a virtueâ€”until your honest opinion crushes someone already suffering.

buildup.text: Jonathan Dancy argued moral reasons don't always point the same direction. Context flips everything.

discovery.text: Particularism says no moral principle is universally valid. Each situation demands fresh judgment.

twist.text: That someone is in pain usually counts against causing more painâ€”but not when a surgeon operates.

climax.text: Moral wisdom isn't knowing rules. It's reading each unique situation with sensitivity and care.

punchline.text: Good ethics is jazz, not sheet music.

quiz.question: What does moral particularism claim about moral principles?
options: Universal principles always apply in every context
No moral principle holds universally; context determines moral relevance
